The complaint also accuses UBS of failing to supervise gifts and gratuities. The action, filed with the state\u2019s Securities Division, seeks a cease-and-desist order, a censure and an undisclosed administrative fine, the statement said. {"abstract": "Ping An Insurance Company plans to buy a $3.2 billion stake in the Shenzhen Development Bank Company.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2009/06/13/business/global/13bizbriefs-CHINESEINSUR_BRF.html", "snippet": "Ping An Insurance Company plans to buy a $3.2 billion stake in the Shenzhen Development Bank Company.", "lead_paragraph": "Ping An Insurance Company, shifting its focus to the Chinese market after losing $3.3 billion on an investment in the European insurer Fortis, plans to buy a 22 billion renminbi ($3.2 billion) stake in the Shenzhen Development Bank Company. Ping An, a major insurer in China, agreed to purchase as many as 585 million new shares from Shenzhen Development for 10.7 billion renminbi, the company said. Ping An will also buy 520.4 million Shenzhen shares from Newbridge Capital, the Asian unit of TPG Inc., for about 11.45 billion renminbi. The stake of Ping An, which already owns 4.7 percent of the Chinese bank, may rise to as much as 34 percent after the transactions. The deal would extend a push by Peter Ma, Ping An\u2019s chairman, to build a financial supermarket, while helping Shenzhen Development plug a capital shortfall. {"abstract": "Since the beginning of the downturn, issuers have created several new premium cards that come with fees and extra services.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2009/09/14/business/14drill.html", "snippet": "Since the beginning of the downturn, issuers have created several new premium cards that come with fees and extra services.", "lead_paragraph": "Continuing a pattern that has held for more than a year, credit card issuers last quarter mailed out fewer new-card offers than they did in the quarter before. But 28 percent more offers were sent to consumers with the best credit for two lines of so-called premium cards. About 118 million pieces of mail went out advertising the MasterCard World and Visa Signature cards, premium cards that come with fees and extra services. That was up from 75 million the quarter before, according to Comperemedia, a firm that tracks direct marketing.", "print_section": "B", "print_page": "3", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Turning to Premium Credit Cards", "kicker": "Drilling Down", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "Turning to Premium Credit Cards", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Credit and Money Cards", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "ADVERTISING AND MARKETING", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Personal Finances", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2009-09-14T03:02:12+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "byline": {"original": "By Alex Mindlin", "person": [{"firstname": "Alex", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Mindlin", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/e1161806-7d2f-5e12-a4b4-fe27d263002b", "word_count": 189, "uri": "nyt://article/e1161806-7d2f-5e12-a4b4-fe27d263002b"}

{"abstract": "Google\u2019s new domain name system has a rival questioning the search giant\u2019s motives.", "web_url": "https://bits.blogs.nytimes.com/2009/12/03/pondering-googles-move-into-the-dns-business/", "snippet": "Google\u2019s new domain name system has a rival questioning the search giant\u2019s motives.", "lead_paragraph": "People typically lunge for metaphors when trying to describe the Internet\u2019s Domain Name System, or D.N.S., so here\u2019s mine: think of D.N.S. as one of those switchboard operators at the old Ma Bell telephone company. Each Internet service provider has its own bank of these operators, called D.N.S. servers. Type in a Web address \u2014 nytimes.com, for example \u2014 and the ISP\u2019s operator looks up the numerical IP address of the site and connects the call.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Pondering Google\u2019s Move Into the D.N.S. Business", "kicker": "Bits", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "organizations", "value": "Google Inc", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "OpenDNS", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2009-12-03T22:38:48+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Technology", "byline": {"original": "By Brad Stone", "person": [{"firstname": "Brad", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Stone", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "", "_id": "nyt://article/a1ced18d-6aeb-5dd1-b6ff-fea1d2237c6d", "word_count": 591, "uri": "nyt://article/a1ced18d-6aeb-5dd1-b6ff-fea1d2237c6d"}

{"abstract": "Under the terms of a settlement in a lawsuit over payment processing, merchants can charge higher prices to customers who pay with credit cards.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2012/07/14/business/mastercard-and-visa-settle-antitrust-suit.html", "snippet": "Under the terms of a settlement in a lawsuit over payment processing, merchants can charge higher prices to customers who pay with credit cards.", "lead_paragraph": "Retailers will be able to charge their customers more for paying with credit cards under the terms of a multibillion-dollar settlement announced late in the day on Friday. {"abstract": "Businesses weighed next moves after a deal that allows merchants to offer discounts to those paying with cash, and to impose fees on those using plastic.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2012/07/17/business/merchants-consider-credit-card-surcharges-or-cash-discounts.html", "snippet": "Businesses weighed next moves after a deal that allows merchants to offer discounts to those paying with cash, and to impose fees on those using plastic.", "lead_paragraph": "Starting this week, prices are 2 percent lower on ScanMyPhotos.com. At the grocer Kroger, executives are contemplating charging two prices for groceries \u2014 a lower price when shoppers pay with cash, and a higher one when they use a credit card. And at restaurants across the country, owners are weighing the wisdom \u2014 or lack of it \u2014 of a surcharge on bills paid with credit cards.", "print_section": "B", "print_page": "1", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Merchants Considering Credit Card Surcharges", "kicker": null, "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "Merchants Considering Credit Card Surcharges", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Shopping and Retail", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Visa Inc", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "MasterCard Inc", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Credit Cards", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2012-07-17T01:52:21+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "byline": {"original": "By Stephanie Clifford and Stephanie Strom", "person": [{"firstname": "Stephanie", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Clifford", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}, {"firstname": "Stephanie", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Strom", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 2}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/2494e429-7653-5acb-bf4b-12319009cfe0", "word_count": 944, "uri": "nyt://article/2494e429-7653-5acb-bf4b-12319009cfe0"}

{"abstract": "Mata Amritanandamayi, known as Amma, is a globe-trotting guru who embraces the masses \u2014 and a get-it-done management style for her charities.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2013/05/26/business/ammas-multifaceted-empire-built-on-hugs.html", "snippet": "Mata Amritanandamayi, known as Amma, is a globe-trotting guru who embraces the masses \u2014 and a get-it-done management style for her charities.", "lead_paragraph": "THERE are entourages \u2014 and then there is the retinue of Mata Amritanandamayi, a 59-year-old Indian guru known simply as Amma, or \u201cmother.\u201d On Friday, she began a two-month North American tour during which she will be accompanied by 275 volunteers. They plan to ride in four buses across the continent from Bellevue, Wash., to Marlborough, Mass., visiting 11 cities, including New York. And at each stop along the way, Amma will sit on stage for 15 hours at a stretch, greeting her thousands of devotees. {"abstract": "Carlos Menendez of MasterCard cuts it close on his way to the gate, and he once helped calm a woman shouting in Portuguese that the plane would crash.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2014/01/07/business/translating-a-fellow-passengers-vision-of-doom.html", "snippet": "Carlos Menendez of MasterCard cuts it close on his way to the gate, and he once helped calm a woman shouting in Portuguese that the plane would crash.", "lead_paragraph": "I THINK I have flown on every airline existing on the planet at least once. Family members and people I work with call me a \u201crisk\u201d because I too often barely make it to flights on time. I like to maximize the time I have, so I do cut it close. On two occasions I had to get out of a taxi and walk along the highway, roller dragging behind me, briefcase tightly tucked under my arm and cellphone blasting calls for help, just to be sure I made {"abstract": "Investors may be betting that Alibaba will move into digital entertainment, but they are too easily excited, contends Robyn Mak of Reuters Breakingviews.", "web_url": "https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2014/03/13/star-struck-by-alibaba-movie-company-deal/", "snippet": "Investors may be betting that Alibaba will move into digital entertainment, but they are too easily excited, contends Robyn Mak of Reuters Breakingviews.", "lead_paragraph": "The e-commerce giant Alibaba\u2019s latest deal shows the extent of investor frenzy for China\u2019s Internet. The company announced on Tuesday that it had agreed to buy 60 percent of the ChinaVision Media Group, which is listed in Hong Kong, for $804 million. The film company\u2019s market value promptly soared to almost $5 billion. Star-struck investors are too easily excited.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Star-Struck by Alibaba\u2019s Movie Company Deal", "kicker": "DealBook", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Ma, Jack", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "ALIBABA.COM", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "glocations", "value": "China", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2014-03-13T16:09:10+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "byline": {"original": "By Robyn Mak", "person": [{"firstname": "Robyn", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Mak", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/e5b401cf-c6da-50a4-bd49-dca3c64b2922", "word_count": 392, "uri": "nyt://article/e5b401cf-c6da-50a4-bd49-dca3c64b2922"}

{"abstract": "Alibaba unveils the 27 individuals in its controlling partnership. | A rival offer is expected to challenge G.E.\u2019s bid for Alstom. | A bank account screening tool is under regulatory scrutiny. | Medtronic has agreed to buy Covidien.", "web_url": "https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2014/06/16/morning-agenda-alibabas-inner-circle-revealed/", "snippet": "Alibaba unveils the 27 individuals in its controlling partnership. | A rival offer is expected to challenge G.E.\u2019s bid for Alstom. | A bank account screening tool is under regulatory scrutiny. | Medtronic has agreed to buy Covidien.", "lead_paragraph": "The Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group on Monday publicly disclosed the names of all 27 individuals who will make up the company\u2019s select inner circle in an amended initial public offering prospectus, DealBook\u2019s Michael J. de la Merced writes. {"abstract": "Growth worries have afflicted all technology stocks and Chinese ones in particular. {"abstract": "Alibaba\u2019s mobile-payment affiliate and a private-equity firm will buy part of Yum\u2019s China unit for a good price, but the deal may also pay off for Yum.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2016/09/03/business/dealbook/yum-brands-in-china-adds-owners-with-skill-and-connections.html", "snippet": "Alibaba\u2019s mobile-payment affiliate and a private-equity firm will buy part of Yum\u2019s China unit for a good price, but the deal may also pay off for Yum.", "lead_paragraph": "Yum Brands has added some spice at a price. The company, which owns KFC and Pizza Hut, is selling part of its China business to Alibaba\u2019s mobile-payments affiliate and a private-equity firm run by Fred Hu, the former chairman of Goldman Sachs China. They bring valuable technology skill and connections. It is a better deal than usual for so-called cornerstone investors, but may pay off for Yum\u2019s coming spinoff.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Yum Brands in China Adds Owners With Skill and Connections", "kicker": "Breakingviews", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "New Owners Add Skill and Connections Yum\u2019s Menu in China", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Fast Food Industry", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Ant Financial Services Group", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "China Investment Corp", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Kentucky Fried Chicken", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Yum Brands Inc", "rank": 5, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Ma, Jack", "rank": 6, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2016-09-02T21:03:34+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "subsection_name": "DealBook", "byline": {"original": "By Kevin Allison", "person": [{"firstname": "Kevin", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Allison", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/6c05801d-0e79-55d3-ab4c-7581fe7388c9", "word_count": 359, "uri": "nyt://article/6c05801d-0e79-55d3-ab4c-7581fe7388c9"}
